# Goals

Learn how to

<div class="indented1">
- Work with R and RStudio
- Importing data from SF's Open Data portal into R
- Exploring and visualizing one and two dimensional data
- Create simple interactive maps in a browser
-	Perform geoprocessing tasks like buffers and intersections
-	Use spatial queries to select features
-	Conduct basic statistical analyses. 
- Finding resources to continue learning on your own

# R and RStudio

![](images/rlogo_120x120.png)

- a **software platform** for data maniuplation and analysis 
- a computational **programming language**
- based on **S**
- first came out in 1995

![](images/rstudio_378x127.png)

- a popular integrated development environment for R
- simplifies a lot of maintenance
- extends the capabilities of R through HTML
